abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability is unlikely, and the
            institutional development impact is negligible. The Bank
            performance varied from marginally unsatisfactory, to
            marginally satisfactory, and, the lack of Government
            commitment to privatization, resulted in an unsatisfactory
            Borrower performance. Lessons address first, the problems on
            the line of credit, and technical assistance (TA)
            components. Fixing the business environment, in parallel
            with offering a line of credit, requires reforms in the
            financial sector, in tandem with improved legal, and
            judiciary framework, particularly dispute resolution
            mechanisms, and collateral systems; but mostly, the
            instrumental potential of a credit line should have been
            used to influence policy reforms in those areas, in addition
            to identifying financial inter-mediation early on, and
            assessing the relevance of the credit line. The provision of
            TA should be ensured by policy dialogue, and government
            commitment, in synergy between the credit, and all TA
            components. Second, on the sector reform, and privatization
            components, rather than confront parliamentary deadlock, the
            project could have experienced with community based
            infrastructure programs, which do not require parliamentary
            approval; and, explicit project objectives, where
            privatization is but a mean, would have benefited
            infrastructure reform.
